# Security Policy

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you discover a security vulnerability in ListenBrainz, please report it responsibly.

- **Do not** open a public issue or pull request for security vulnerabilities.
- Please use GitHub Security Advisories to report vulnerabilities privately:
  https://github.com/metabrainz/listenbrainz-server/security/advisories/new

If you are unable to use GitHub Security Advisories, you may contact the MetaBrainz team via their official contact channels listed on:
https://metabrainz.org/about/contact

## What to Include

When reporting a vulnerability, please include:
- A clear description of the issue
- Steps to reproduce, if applicable
- Any relevant logs, screenshots, or proof of concept
- The potential impact of the vulnerability

## Disclosure Policy

The MetaBrainz team will review reported vulnerabilities and work to address them in a timely manner.  
Public disclosure should only occur after a fix has been released or with explicit coordination from the maintainers.

## Supported Versions

Security updates are applied to the current production deployment and supported release branches.
